result.execSummary:
The defendant Levar Deshon Wells was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Delivery of Cocaine (>5-15g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge. To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance shall be due by 7/1/2018.  Failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
No use or possession/use of alcohol or controleld substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
Not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $150.00 at one time.
No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
May not have more than one more phone number registered to your name at one time.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster or any body armor.
May not live where a firearm is kept.
May not be in any automobile where a firearm is present.
Not to associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate.
No contact with any known illegal drug user except in AODA program.
No contact with any known illegal drug manufacturer or deliverer.

Participate in cognitive behavior program or cognitive intervention program.
Fine set at zero.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  firearm possession and voting.
-------------------------------------------------
Court advised defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended and that the defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to Extended Supervision; and a violation of any of those conditions may result in  the defendant being returned to prison.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Levar Deshon Wells in court with attorney Peter J. Kovac.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 8 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 3 days (09-29-2014 to 10-01-2011) time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.  

Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety:  No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing. 
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $150.00 at one time.
- No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
- Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to you name at one time. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept. 
- Defendant may not be in any automobile where a firearm is present. 
- Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate. 
- No contact with any known illegal drug user except in AODA program.
- No contact with any known illegal drug manufacturer or deliverer.
- Defendant to participate in a Cognitive Behavior program or cognitive intervention program.
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance shall be due by 07-01-2018; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Letter on behalf of the defendant received and filed. tk
Packet of Letters on behalf of the defendant received and filed. tk

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Case adjourned for sentencing hearing, Branch 17.

Defendant Levar Deshon Wells in court with attorney Peter J. Kovac.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Original Information filed. 
AS TO COUNT 1: On motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed but read in for sentencing.
AS TO COUNT 2: On motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed but read in for sentencing.
AS TO COUNT 3: Charges amended to read as Count 1 on the Information: Delivery of Controlled Substance (Cocaine) (>5-15 Grams), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections 961.41(1)(cm)2, 939.50(3)(e) , a Class E Felony.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Levar Deshon Wells in court with attorney Peter J. Kovac.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Arraignment scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription, Oral  No Weapons Order  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 05-22-2015 at 08:30 am.
